alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Garland; Grant; Hot Spring; Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations; Saline; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 10 at 11:31PM CDT until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Arkansas, southwest Arkansas and western Arkansas, including the following areas, in central Arkansas, Garland, Grant and Saline. In southwest Arkansas, Hot Spring. In western Arkansas, Central and Eastern Montgomery County, Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations and Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Locally heavy rainfall is expected across portions of the watch area through early Thursday afternoon. Rainfall amounts of 2-3 inches will be possible along with locally higher totals.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Garland; Grant; Hot Spring; Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations; Saline; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations
